title: Drawing, "Two designs for andirons", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow, red-brown, green watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper
inscribed:
Above--below lion, pen and brown ink: No. 128
Below--below center, pen and brown ink: No. 129
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description:
Above, a lion stands in profile, front right paw on a ball. Pilasters decorated with a vertical plant design, a ball atop. Front panel decorated with oak leaf design.

Below, a railing consisting of ovals with floral centers connected by rosettes. Protruding pilasters with decorated arrows intertwined with wreaths, large ball atop left pilaster.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Two designs for andirons", 1800–25.
1800–25. Brush and yellow, red-brown, green watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-164.
